image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Reformist faces ultraconservative as Iran votes for president
item.description: Iranians voted Friday in a presidential election runoff between a reformist advocating improved ties with the West and an ultraconservative former nuclear negotiator. The runoff between reformist Masoud Pezeshkian and ultraconservative Saeed Jalili comes amid heightened regional tensions over the Gaza war, Iran's nuclear standoff with the West and widespread economic discontent exacerbated by Western sanctions.

item.title: Royal on Wheels: Prince Williams zips into Windsor castle on e-scooter
item.description: Prince William, spotted riding an electric scooter into Windsor Castle, uses the device to reduce his commute time. Purchased last year, the scooter facilitates travel between his home and the castle. Known for his love of motorcycles, William celebrated his 42nd birthday at a Taylor Swift concert with his children.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Fierce fighting breaks out as militias launch new attacks against regime in Myanmar's civil war
item.description: New fighting in northeastern Myanmar has reignited tensions as powerful militias target regime positions. The military faces pressure from multiple fronts in the civil war. The situation remains fluid as forces clash in Shan state and Mandalay region.

item.title: Karachi faces fuel shortage amid strike of petroleum dealers
World food prices hold firm in June, UN's FAO reports
item.description: UN FAO's June index remained at 120.6. Vegetable oil climbed 3.1%, boosted by palm, soy, and sunflower oil. Dairy rose 1.2%, sugar 1.9% amid low Brazilian harvests. Cereals fell 3%, with maize increases in Argentina, Brazil. Meat stable. 2024 cereal forecast: 2.854B tons. Index hit three-year low in February post-Ukraine invasion.

item.title: 'Growth oriented' or 'Barbaric'? Greece's 6-day work law sparks row
item.description: Greece's new six-day workweek allows certain 24-hour industries to pay extra for over 40 hours. Prime Minister Mitsotakis supports this growth initiative despite union and Syriza concerns. Minister Kerameus assures five-day norms stay. Greece, facing long workweeks, poverty, and post-crisis austerity, diverges from Sanders' 32-hour week proposal. The European Central Bank was involved.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Florida man uses alligator's teeth to open beer can in viral clip
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Scottish independence hit as SNP suffers 'black night' in UK poll
item.description: Scotland's SNP faced a blow at the UK election, losing to Labour led by Keir Starmer. Stephen Flynn called it a 'black night.' SNP loses key positions including Prime Minister's Questions. Ex-leader Sturgeon, finance scandal; Peter Murrell charged with embezzlement. Labour wins majority in Britain; independence contentious post-2014 referendum, Scottish Greens deal collapses.

item.title: Record number of UK Cabinet ministers defeated in general election
How Keir Starmer defied expectations to lift Labour back to power
item.description: Starmer has now led Labour to victory, potentially securing the largest majority in Parliament since Tony Blair’s New Labour landslide in 1997. The presumptive prime minister has significantly exceeded expectations since succeeding the hard-left leader Jeremy Corbyn in 2020. Despite being seen as bland and boring, and not a "Tony Blair," Starmer has partially benefited from favorable circumstances, helping him revive Labour's prospects.

item.title: Iran votes in runoff election to replace President Raisi who died in crash
item.description: Iran gears up for a presidential election runoff between Pezeshkian and Jalili following a record-low turnout in the first round. Both candidates have differing views on international relations and economic challenges. The election outcome could have significant implications for Iran's future direction.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia accuses US fighter jet of coming dangerously close to Russian plane
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK parliamentary elections: Why Rishi Sunak's Conservative Party suffered a historic defeat
item.description: Keir Starmer will be Britain's next PM with his centre left Labour Party expected to win a huge majority in a parliamentary election, ending 14 years of often tumultuous Conservative government by trouncing Rishi Sunak's party. "Tonight, people here and around the country have spoken and they're ready for change, to end the politics of performance, a return to politics as public service," Starmer said after winning his seat in London.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I am sorry': Rishi Sunak concedes defeat in UK general election, congratulates Keir Starmer for landslide victory
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Police officer shoots man who killed 8-year-old brother in New York
item.description: In Queens, New York, a police officer fatally shot a man who had allegedly stabbed his 8-year-old brother and parents. Responding to a distress call, officers found the suspect holding his father hostage with a knife. Despite commands to drop the weapon, he did not comply, prompting the officer to fire, saving the father's life. Both brothers succumbed to their injuries, while their parents received medical care.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
